items.description: River Churn and its tributaries

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
The flood risk remains.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, river levels along the River Churn remain high, particularly in Cerney Wick. The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through today, 28 December, overnight and into tomorrow, 29 December 2025. River levels are falling very slowly. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 29 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
The flood risk remains.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue as river levels along the River Windrush remain high, particularly in Bourton on the Water and Newbridge areas. The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through today, 28 December, overnight and into tomorrow, 29 December 2025. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 29 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.message:
The flood risk remains.

Flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today in the Bourton on the Water area.  The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through today, 28 December, overnight and into tomorrow, 29 December 2025. River levels are currently stable but starting to fall. We expect river levels to remain high over the coming days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 29 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower Frome and tributaries
items.message: River levels remain high but are falling slowly on the Lower Frome. Flooding may still be affecting low lying areas near to the River Frome in the Dorchester, West Stafford, Bockhampton, Lewell, Tincleton, Pallington, Waddock, Moreton, Wool, East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham areas. No significant rain is forecast for today or tomorrow and river levels are falling slowly. We will continue to monitor the forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should continue to monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 03:00 PM on 29 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: River Thames and tributaries from Buscot Wick down to Kings Lock
items.message:
High river levels have led to flooding of land close to the river.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, as river levels on the River Thames remain high, particularly between Rushey and Northmoor Locks. The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through today, 28 December, overnight and into tomorrow, 29 December 2025. River levels are falling slowly, but are expected to remain high over the coming days. River levels between Lechlade and Radcot are now below the flood risk threshold, but standing water is likely to remain on paths and fields alongside the river.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 29 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Thames and tributaries in the Oxford area
items.message:
High river levels have led to flooding of land close to the river.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue, particularly in the Wolvercote and Osney areas, as the River Thames and watercourses through Oxford remain high. The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through today, 28 December, overnight and into tomorrow, 29 December 2025. River levels are now falling steadily. It is expected that river levels will remain high over the coming days.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 29 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower Tone and Parrett Moors
items.message: River levels are falling but flooding is possible for Lower Rivers Tone and Parrett including West Moor, Hay Moor, Curry Moor, Stan Moor, Salt Moor and North Moor. The River Tone level at Currymoor pumping station is falling slowly (currently 6.64m). Water is no longer entering Currymoor via Hookbridge spillway as this level has dropped below 7.45m. The drain level at Currymoor pumping station is 5.98m and is falling. Cutts Road floods when the drain level at Currymoor pumping station is above 5.75m, and New Road when the level is above 6.18m. Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area. Dry weather is forecast for the next few days. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. Pumping will continue at at Currymoor as needed and when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 29 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message: High and rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area. Groundwater levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Levels may continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Further rainfall is expected over the next few days which may see levels continue to rise. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. We are closely monitoring the situation . Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 30 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cranborne Chase area
items.message:
High groundwater levels may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the 23rd December 2025 onwards 
Groundwater levels have risen in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed . 
This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 30 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Piddle and tributaries
items.message: River levels remain high due to the recent heavy rainfall but are falling slowly. Flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible. Flooding could still affect locations near the River Piddle, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alton Pancras and Wareham. There is no significant rain forecast for today or tomorrow. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should continue to monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 03:00 PM on 29 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

The weather forecast is for dry conditions to continue through today, 28 December, overnight and into tomorrow, 29 December 2025. River levels are currently high, but falling slowly and we expect river levels to remain high over the coming days. 

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 12:00, midday, on the 29 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, Yeovilton to Huish Episcopi
items.message: Water levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett and surrounding moors. But with dry weather forecast for the days ahead. Low lying land and roads are expected to be most affected by flooding, particularly around the A37 south and A303 south west of Ilchester, the Ilchester to Limington road and road to Ilchester Meads. There is also a risk of flooding around Hainbury Mill, Ilchester. Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. And we are pumping when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 12:00 PM on 29 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, The Levels

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain, River Sowy

items.message: Water levels remain high on the River Parrett and surrounding moors. Dry weather forecast for the days ahead. Low lying land and roads are expected to still be most affected by flooding. Please refer to the latest gauge levels on Check for Flooding and Somerset Council’s website for information on road closures in the area. We continue to rainfall and river levels. And we are pumping and operating the (Sowy) Parrett Relief Channel as needed and when river levels allow. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 12:00 PM on 29 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding for the Hooke
items.message:
High groundwater levels are expected to cause flooding. 

Flooding is expected from the 23rd December 2025 onwards 

Groundwater levels in West Dorset remain high. Areas that could be affected include: Hooke, Toller Whelme and Toller Porcorum. The groundwater level at the Dickley Down borehole has risen to 165m, and is expected to rise over the next few days. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Flooding of roads is expected, and roads may have become damaged by floodwater. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 

This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 30 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding for the South Winterbourne Valley
items.message:
High groundwater levels are expected to cause flooding. 

Flooding is expected from 23rd December 2025 onwards 

Groundwater levels in West Dorset remain high. Areas that could be affected include: Winterbourne Abbas, Winterbounre Steepleton, Martinstown, Winterborne Monkton, Winterbourne Herringston and Winterborne Came. The groundwater level at the Kingston Russell borehole has risen to 118m, and is expected to continue rising in next few days. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Properties may experience flooding in cellars in affected areas. Flooding of roads is expected, Roads may be damaged by floodwater. intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 

This message will be updated by 3:00PM on 30 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
